website_summaries.verdict: Versatile and efficient, this corded reciprocating saw offers handy features and power that doesn't quit.
pros: Robust motor easily handles extended use
Large adjustable speed trigger with lock-on button
User friendly design with tool-less blade change and shoe adjustments
Built-in dust blower keeps cut line clear
Tough and durable enough for heavy-duty use
cons: Can be prone to heating up during intensive use

website_summaries.verdict: A sawzall for DIY folks that pros wouldn’t be embarrassed to use, this reciprocating saw tackles a variety of demolition and precision cutting tasks.
pros: Keyless chuck enables fast blade changes
Less powerful 9-amp motor allows better control and cutting precision
Cuts old wood fences, metal fence posts, and more with ease
Doesn’t bog down after hours of use
cons: Tool grows hot after continuous use
Some users are stymied by the blade-changing process

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Decided to go with the Makita over the Dewalt since it came with a case and the Milwaukee since it was a bit cheaper. First Makita product and pretty happy with it. Used it first to tear up a deck with Diablo blades. Cut some old pipe and it sliced right through it. Next job is remodeling a bathroom. Seems like a tough tool I'll have for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for regular use
customer_reviews.text: I like that you're able to lock the trigger into place, and remove the shew easily. Power is good. I don't like how the turn lock gets buried, which makes it difficult to get to the blade exchange. Overall it's a good saw, would recommend it. I'm a full-time remodeler carpenter.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Having a good/right tool makes hard work easier.
customer_reviews.text: Did some basic research on this before purchase and found this to be rated near the top of the recommended list. Replaced an old Craftsman that I had. Needed this to cut through lumber, nails and screws. Equipped with the appropriate blade, did a fine job. Really like the ease of changing blades. Plenty of power to accomplish the task. Comfortable to use. I have good confidence in the brand and since I'm not using it commercially expect it to last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Les Active

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the most part
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a beast as many have already said. I used it with a Diablo 9" pruning blade and it cut through 2 fence post without isse. The only negative is the cord. I hate them. I need to use a 50' extension cable to get to my yard. If you can afford a cordless, get it. I won't really be using this saw that much that a little bit of annoyance can be dealt with.
customer_reviews.author: Zsavooz

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my adult daughter, who lives in another state. She has used it on a couple projects already and tells me that it's a great tool for a homeowner like herself to own. I was worried that it might be too heavy for her -- as she is a small woman -- but she didn't have any trouble using it. I also ordered a set of Milwaukee blades for her to use with this saw, which are high quality blades and should last a long time. Makita makes good quality tools, and this reciprocating saw is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: David Vincent

customer_reviews.title: super dependable
customer_reviews.text: I have an old one that I broke...My fault. Bought this new one to replace older model. You just can't beat any thing with this name on it. I really use my tools and hard long projects. Right now I am replacing a 2nd story floor in a commercial building that fell and everything was in a bad and dangerous bind. It is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: kent dubose

customer_reviews.title: 1st use today to lift up linoleum in restroom remodel ...
customer_reviews.text: 1st use today to lift up linoleum in restroom remodel, already set back because this item no longer works. Halfway through 5x8 restroom and its failed. My return window on amazon closed before i had a chance to use it. Seriously disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Efren Pelayo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It's a makita, only cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I have come to expect from makita. The power and the quality with the warranty of the brand, plus it was 35 less than the competitors. I love the power of this saw, when you hold it correctly there is zero vibration. The variable speed is handy also. The length of the cord is a nice bonus as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hutter

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I originally wanted the Milwaukee fuel cordless, but when I saw this for only 89$ plus a nice hard case so it doesn't get destroyed by simply storing it with other tools, I had to get it. 11 amps is enough really I had a 13 amp Milwaukee, and this is not much different in cutting power. I'm big on taking care of my tools so they last a long time, so this case adds years to its life. I had a DeWalt drill I got in a set, and didn't even use it for about 6 months, and it looked 2 years old before I even used it because of no case.
customer_reviews.author: Cody lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected and cuts nicely through thick pipe or pressure treated wood. Comes with a nice, hard plastic case too which is always nice for storage and keeping extra blades. Its also really quick an easy to change the blades, although it seems to always take a second or two of staring at it to remember how.
customer_reviews.author: JoshuaK

customer_reviews.title: I think you will like this saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw will last the rest of my life. It may not have the ability to rotate the blade but so what. Changing blades is easy, and there's plenty of power. The weight hits the sweet spot, making it easy to use while giving a solid feel. The only possible con is that the trigger lock is very easy to activate accidentally. Not worth deducting a star for this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Mac

customer_reviews.title: used sawzall
customer_reviews.text: product working good so far but it looks used. inside of the case was cracked. small blemishes and scratches on case and tool. I mean if i am paying for a new product I would expect one.
customer_reviews.author: mr c

customer_reviews.title: Cant go wrong with Makita
customer_reviews.text: Best price for a great product by Makita. Tough and easy to handle, has performed like a champion no matter what the job may be. Also the keyless chuck is quality. I am totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: Got it done !
customer_reviews.text: Used this today for the 1st time to cut behind door trims and remove door jams on 6 doors ... both sides worked a treat only issue is trying to balance in on a step on the ladder when not in use .. more times than not i placed it in the floor power was great for this job ..
customer_reviews.author: ror

customer_reviews.title: Not half bad
customer_reviews.text: Not bad it gets the job done but I bent the metal blade when I hit a screw in my wall. I not sure I like the way you connect the blades. After cutting thru about 6 metal studs in my wall the blade was pretty dull. I’ll be buying some better quality blades for this thing. Overall I am pretty happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product, as expected from MAKITA
customer_reviews.text: Terrific product, as expected from MAKITA. This was a factory refurbished item, all bugs ironed out. Came with brand new case, pack of blades and the saw itself is in brand new condition. $89 bucks can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaylev

customer_reviews.title: Decent but....
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a decent tool, but it took about 5 minutes to cut through a six inch diameter log with a Bosch pruning blade. I could do it faster by hand. Not sure what's going on here.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Tough and never hesitates... gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Sure came in handy for hurricane cleanup after Irma. A neighbor's tree fell on our screened enclosure and roof. This saw made quick work of the tangled aluminum framework. Cut through nail and screws... even cut some smaller trees. It made the whole effort much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for When You Have to Hide that Body
customer_reviews.text: Equipped with the proper blades, I have yet to find a substance this won't cut.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Devil

customer_reviews.title: First class. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: A first class tool. I nearly bought a desalt but I’m pleased I didn’t. It handles the tasks so well and is so simple on the blade change.
customer_reviews.author: Eilsel

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time tool user and this is one of the best. I'm glad I chose this brand saw. Update-This saw stopped working after 6 months. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ray from PA

customer_reviews.title: I use this on my farm from everything from building ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my farm from everything from building retaining walls out of 6X6X10 treated boards or railroad ties, to building a barn and equipment covers. This tool worked flawlessly and made all these different jobs so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart A. Joynt

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I was using another saw that broke so decide to get this saw. The saw is very good. It not to heavy which is nice. I think the cutting quality depend on the blades you buy. I have no issue with this product. I really like and glad that I have it
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: As with most Makita products, this is a robust product and has plenty of power to do the job right
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent! I've used Milwaukee for the past 20 years
customer_reviews.text: Most excellent! I've used Milwaukee for the past 20 years. I am very pleased with this Makita at a lower price point than the Milwaukee. You Tube videos place this and the Milwaukee on the same ranking.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great saw great value
customer_reviews.text: Really solid and powerful saw. Cuts just about anything provided you use the right blade. This is one of man's greatest inventions- right up there with the wheel and fire.
customer_reviews.author: fred k

customer_reviews.title: powerful And good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a few times so far but the power is definitely there! It cuts like a champ! The tool free blade replacement is a great feature. My old dewalt recip died and I’m glad it did! This was a good upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jolie

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and does what was needed. I am ...
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and does what was needed. I am at the point in my life where I want quality tools that will last and will wait till I find the right tool at the right price and this one fits that bill to a T.
customer_reviews.author: MRM

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cut tops off 2 3/8 metal fence posts as well as demo old wooden fence. Works like a champ. Haven't use the enclosed metal cutting and wood cutting blades and purchased 6" Carbide tipped demo blade and 6" Thick metal cutting blade for my initial project needs. Case appears to be strong and of good quality as well. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Russell L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Blade engagement
customer_reviews.text: Good saw but the blade changing needs work; the rubber collar is not easy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E. Creel

customer_reviews.title: Saw in the “palm” of my hand.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for many different uses. I used it to trim palm tree branches using 10 inch blades.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and safe to use.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for cutting down small trees. Really like the variable speed and ease of handling. Blades are easy to insert and lock into place. Like it a lot better than a chain saw because it it easy to use and do not have to mess with gas,oil or a chain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Demolish to your little hearts content
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a monster. I used it to destroy an entire fiberglass hot tub on my patio in over 100 degree heat and it DESTROYED it. We did have to stop to take breaks to prevent overheating (its a hot tool in summer) but this saw is fantastic for cutting oversized, hard to reach, odd angled materials. Blades are easy to change and MUCH more safely secured than the other, older style (which often loosen and eject the blade out the front while running). Do yourself a favor and buy this. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Had the same one liked it so much we replaced it with the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quality, fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Received item as promised, good quality, fast shipping. Very nice tool, comes in handy. Works as expected. Nice carry case. Would buy from these people again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, plenty of power. I've used it to cut a 4x10 beam into 24" lengths. It cut through it with no problem. I've been very satisfied with all of my Makita tools.
customer_reviews.author: Redhawk44

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this saw....what a little workhorse! Today, I took this tree all the way down to stumps using my Makita JR3050T. What a great saw! Definitely recommend! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: JP1970

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Power Tool
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this saw. He did have to purchase a longer blade for one of his projects. Like all Makita power tools, this is a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Country Gal

customer_reviews.title: My number one tool this Summer
customer_reviews.text: The number one tool I used to rid my patio of an old deck. Many blades later I no longer have a deck I hate and still have a saw that is a keeper
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the tool for some jobs
customer_reviews.text: Just what u needed. Wish it fit back in the case easier
customer_reviews.author: Tom Guy

customer_reviews.title: Using common sense when operating a power tool.
customer_reviews.text: It takes care of business. Playing with wood, now, is more fun!
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Tear down this wall
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through building materials like butter. We ripped out 800 square feet of moldy finished basement in a day.
customer_reviews.author: User One

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great saw For that it’s small and fits in tight ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great saw For that it’s small and fits in tight spots that a super sawzall cannot I lost the shoe the first day whatever but other than that I love it
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: good quality, on time delivery
customer_reviews.text: like makita product this is top noch for the money

customer_reviews.title: A First Class saw!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on arrival to trim some 4x4 fence posts. No problems!
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Saws All?
customer_reviews.text: Sawsall? Can't write that. Copywrighted by American imperialists. It is good for cutting. Or BDSM. You decide.
customer_reviews.author: Red Blooded American

customer_reviews.title: Great saw to have!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw. Purchased it for my husband's birthday but I've wanted one for years! Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lark

customer_reviews.title: This review is coming after having the saw for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This review is coming after having the saw for a year and a half. It has held up incredibly well. I work in construction, so this saw takes a beating almost daily...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Sweet.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for a renovation project and have been using the crap out of it. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Skredberry

customer_reviews.title: Great price, tough as nails
customer_reviews.text: Very tough sawzalls at a great price. We use them in a rough manufacturing environment and they are standing up to the challenge with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Speice

customer_reviews.title: It did what I expected it to do
customer_reviews.text: Used it to remove several trees out of the ground. Worked great and a good price as well
customer_reviews.author: J. STOUT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for outdoor tree cutting work
customer_reviews.text: I've used this saw for about 6 months now, with my typical application being pruning and cutting down small trees with Bosch RP125 12-Inch blades. It is an excellent saw and is holding up really well over time. Although not a chainsaw replacement, this saw does a surprisingly good job with large branches. I keep a few worn-out blades to do the edging of my lawn against my driveway/sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: FrogRescueSquad

customer_reviews.title: Great tool..
customer_reviews.text: Every DIYer needs this sturdy, powerful tool to take care of business! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MostlyHappy

customer_reviews.title: Kills Houses. Dead. (That's a good thing)
customer_reviews.text: Reciprocating saws are awe-inspiring little toys. This on lives up to the Makita brand: solid like a rock, good grip, sturdy blade change mechanism, no nonsense control of speed, angle of attack and enough room to feel reasonably safe while working with it. This is a demolition tool, not intended for your fine cabinetry work; it will eat thru a steel pipe in 30 seconds and rip across a 2x4 in seconds (nails and all) whether you want it to or not.
customer_reviews.author: L. Blackmore

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this item, and I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence H. Sellars

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent corded recip saw for the money. Makita tools are well made and durable. Nice case also.

customer_reviews.title: top quality
customer_reviews.text: This saw is great and really reliable, the ease of use and quality performance is off the chart coming from Makita you know you can't go wrong with this saw. highly recommend this saw

customer_reviews.text: Works great. With a 12" wood blade, I've been able to take care of a ton of trimming around the yard that I had beeen putting off. Glad I decided against the cordless.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love that it comes with a case and two blades. Works very well.

customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful. I used it to cut though a bunch of wall studs. It had no problem with that. I picked up some good blades that I'm sure helped but the saw didn't struggle at all. Very happy with this purchase.

customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to handle and a great tool. Gets the job done....

customer_reviews.title: Superb sawzall.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a Makita power tools at my professional job and have never had a failure so when it came time to purchase power tools for my own shop the decision was easy, Makita !

customer_reviews.text: Kicks ass. sawed up 2 couches that my dogs ate

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, I hate batteries because they go bad wear out etc. This thing with the correct blade does it all!

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: In good working order. Easy to use and plenty powerful.

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good, get's hot, but hasn't skipped a beat and blades sit somewhat loosely in the blade holder and it only did took one blade without twisting the holder, but it cut the heck out of scores of tires that needed to go to the dump (not something I would recommend trying by the way).

customer_reviews.title: Great Solid Reciprocating Saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw because of the "Best Value" rating that it received in the November 2005 issue of Fine Homebuilding. I am very satisfied with it! I especially love the quick blade change system. I have nothing but good to say about Makita tools. I own an arsenal of them. They are, without exception, solid, dependable, comfortable, easy to use and very durable. I am hoping that the qaulity of Makita tools remains high. As long as it is, I will continue to purchase them.

customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift for a friend. He loves it, can't seem to not keep talking about it.

customer_reviews.title: Best Reciprocating Saw on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, very high quality, beast of a saw... It's a Makita, honestly - what else is there to say? It's better than any of the other reciprocating saws I've ever used. Read the instructions on how to insert and remove blades. If you don't, you'll think there is something wrong with the saw and probably leave a bad review about it :)

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the product and purchase through Amazon. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Service and prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: I love Makita brand tools but this seller sent it very quickly, and it was packaged well. I will definitely be checking out there store here on Amazon again! I always recommend Makita over other brands. I have never had one go bad and they last forever.

customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my handy-man son-in-law. He was thrilled. It is a little smaller than many reciprocating saws, and it fits in places that are sometimes hard to get to. I just hope he lets me borrow it once in a while. ;-)

The saw make quick work of the former and was easy to handle, with plenty of power, for the latter. A good buy!

customer_reviews.text: AWSOME!!! This cuts through construction debris and yard debris with ease. Good power and easy to use. Also great value

customer_reviews.text: When you buy a brand name, you expect quality - and this is exactly what you receive. Proud to own this saw!

customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to replaced my 15 year old Makita that was heavily used. This unit works really well and I like the quick blade replacement feature. I had to use a allen wrench with my old one.

product_meta.title: Makita JR3050T Recipro Saw - 11 AMP
product_meta.description: Style:JR3050T recip sawThe Makita 11-Amp Reciprocating Saw (model JR3050T) combines a powerful 11 AMP motor with less weight (7.3 lbs.) for all day use and improved performance. The 11 AMP motor with variable speed (0-2,800 SPM) has a 1-1/8 inch blade stroke for efficient cutting. It is ideal for metal cutting, wood cutting, drywall and plaster, plastics, remodeling, and demolition applications.The JR3050T also features an internal dust blower system to clear debris from the line of cut for improved visibility, with a heavy-duty shoe and “tool-less” blade change for fast blade change and removal. The JR3050T is engineered with all ball and needle bearings for longer tool life, and a durable body design with a protective rubber boot to seal the motor and bearings from dust and debris.

Blade and shoe changes are quick and painless with tool-less adjustment feature
Ball and needle bearings extend tool life; externally accessible brushes allow easy maintenance
Includes plastic case for convenient storage
